pros: I liked working with students and the schedule was flexible

pros: -Progressive -Offers many educational opportunities -Offers many degree programs

pros: Wonderful supervisor. She is knowledgeable and responsive.

job_title: Research Assistant/International student in Baltimore, MD
pros: The work is not that challenging and demanding. You will have some more free time
cons: The student community is weak at the university and I am not sure if my education will help me after graduation. It sounds like this school is still following traditional methods of teaching and research.

pros: Good health insurance and PTO
cons: Performance reviews do not lead to merit based raises

pros: Great opportunity to learn from academics (if you’re interested in that career path).

pros: the benefits and life-work balance
cons: respectability politics are in full swing. If the higher ups are afraid you're coming for their jobs, they'll make sure you don't shine too bright. Shoot themselves in the foot in the long run, but they don't care about the mission, just job security.

pros: It is an ok place
cons: People don’t actually care about your wellbeing, only if the work is getting done.

pros: inclusion and diversity in the workplace

pros: Location is good, campus is appealing.
cons: Salary is much too low.

pros: Most of the employees (senior administrative staff, faculty and support staff are nice to work with.
cons: Lack of (or no offerings of conferences for administrative assistants, pay is poor, some get overtime, others don't, they are behind in online technology, some faculty and staff do not want to change they manage or supervise departments, lack of empathy when it comes to other's feelings/state of mind when it comes to the "workload"; some supervisors/directors/managers do not possess the leadership skills to run a department efficiently, etc.

job_title: Technical Teaching Assistant in Baltimore, MD
pros: Friendly staff, good salary, knowledge sharing, promotion opportunities, and forward looking.
cons: safety issues given the location is in Baltimore, commuting distance is far, etc

review_title: Awful place to work at for white people
pros: Nothing is getting better over a course of a decade. It is going from bad to worse.
cons: Awful place for white people to work at. The environment is permeated with gender- and race- based discrimination. They had three Equal Employment Officers in less than 24 months. None of them wants to hear or resolve complaints. Sexual harassment from the upper management team is prevalent and tolerated (never investigated)! The upper leadership team endorses tormenting white employees. The federal government should not sleep on and support this culture under the assumption that it is the arms of the state. Morgan State University is shame to the state of Maryland.

pros: Openness of Administration during times of crisis.
cons: There simply are no cons

job_title: Director of Admissions in Baltimore, MD
pros:
Helping students achieve
New buildings
Many alums work there and it feels like home
cons:
Low salaries and not consistent across the institution
No work life balance

pros: It is great to get the state employment benefits
cons: The work culture makes it difficult to get things done. There is a lot of "not my problem" behavior.

job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Baltimore, MD
pros: Great atmosphere. Everyone is willing to help.
cons: Some of the processes take too long.

pros: Family environment, Beautiful Campus, Awesome Band, Upgraded/New Buildings
cons: Hard to advance career, but that shows people love the school so much that they stay until retirement.

pros: They cover your room and board fees.
cons: If they cover your room and board fees, then you don't get to keep your pay.

pros: HBCUs are great to learning
cons: None as a rewarding experience

review_title: No Job Growth & No Pay Raise
pros: I get paid to do absolutely nothing, which is much worse than it sounds.  Plenty of potential if the management would just accept change.
cons:
Management is SLOW to accept change, pay it's employees, and give respect to anyone that doesn't have a Ph.D.  You either fall into the ranks of doing 6 jobs at once, or doing nothing while working, some like me, have the choice from day to day.  Morgan will pay you half to three quarters lower than the national average, which when paired with doing 6 jobs at once is just disrespectful.

Morgan is slow to pay its employees consistently, and when they do forget to pay you, it's up to you to make the correction.  Total disrespect to employees without higher degrees, and there lack of any change of pay increase or increase in benefits or job security.

pros: I learned so much which kept me busy so the days went by very quickly.  Planning events was a challenge that I truly enjoyed.  Last but not least, I truly enjoyed working with the Graduate Students who were younger than I in most cases and it gave me a great feeling for what the future holds.
cons: I don't like to go into negative things, yet you are asking for a reason so I will mention I found some individuals were employed for a long time and felt their being there meant they did not have to  carry their work load nor were they friendly.  Morale  was very low due to people not wanting to work.  I always kept my head high no matter how negative some where.

review_title: You will go the extra mile until you have nothing left.
pros: The educational mission is strong. There was a good commitment to teaching and providing tools for student success.
cons: There was no limit to how much service was requested of you. I am not sure if it was because of the stresses of being in that community, but there was an unnaturally high incidence of illness.  There was very little faculty input in governance--even though there was a faculty council, their role was advisory. Once you were locked in to a salary, then it was difficult to get raises. There were people there who had remained static and a lot of salary compression vis a vis new hires. As it tries to increase its research profile, which is laudable, there were growing pains and conflicts with the teaching mission.

pros: Pace is slow and office is usually quiet. You get to spend all day at a desk at a university. Benefits are great.
cons: You have to sit all day at a desk, pace is slow. Pay is extremely low. Little or no opportunities for growth. Most positions are contractual and paid time off stinks. Contract renews annually on July 1, but you can't accrue enough hours between July and December to cover unpaid days during winter break when the university is closed.

job_title: Resident Assistant in New York, NY
pros: ORL looks out for their staff. They help to train you to make sure that you can do your job effectively. They show us how to be leaders on campus and why it is important to interact and engage with the residents. It can be a great experience as long as you have great time management.
cons: The living conditions are not the best and the hours are ok. The biggest struggle comes from the problematic residents, missing night managers, fights and the last minute requests.  Some of the RD's can be difficult, and what maybe ok with one, may not be with another.

job_title: Student Systems Administrator in Scottsdale, AZ
pros: I get alot of experience in the I.T. and electrical engineering profession. It has contributed to 8 eight years of my total experience and now I have a total of 10 years experience.
cons: I do not get paid for what I do and nor would I want to get paid. The environment is and work is always changing and you can not really give your input on the work it is just do what I tell you.

pros: This company cares about its employees.  They listen to their concerns and ideas.  They are truly a team based organization.
cons: This company needs to benefit those who are performing rather those that have been here the longest.

review_title: This was most definitely a learning experience.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: The best reason to work at MSU is the tuition waiver. It not only applies to Morgan but to all of the schools in the University System of Maryland. I definitely learned a lot about how to deal with multiple people of various ethnicities at varying levels.
cons: Morgan is on the lower end of the pay scale within the University System. We went without merit increases and cost of living raises for four years.

pros: Working at Morgan State University afforded me the opportunity to exercise my IT skills in the education industry rather than business.
cons: During the internship, there was a lack of communication at one point where student-employees were unaware of a new e-mail address that would be given and was where the contracts came in.

review_title: My Great Years as a research assistant
pros: Working at Morgan State has been a great opportunity for me. The professors have been courteous and helpful in every opportunity I have faced. If given another opportunity I would do it again.
cons: Not many but since the university is in a transition phase with a new president, there are stil some old values that need to be left in the past. Other than that not much to dislike.

pros: While working at the Academic Enrichment Program, you meet the greatest people. The tutor team is very family oriented. My supervisor is very friendly and will help you out with any problems that you have.
cons: Although the job is great, the pay is very low. You have to participate in the same training every semester. The other branches of the ORL&H staff are not always friendly.

review_title: Excellent teachers, who educates students and provided me with a Federal Work Study.
pros: My positional was well balanced and delivering customer service to students filled my heart. The responsibilities are well organized. It's a terrific environment.
cons: I don't have any con to report. Besides I'm optimistic.

review_title: Good place to get paid and relax

easy work
competitive compensation compare to other school
very flexible work time
kind people
loose environment
nice place to live
cons:
work is of little challenge

pros: There are so many events to attend on campus.  It's a great educational system.
cons: The pay is very low.  Some of the employees attitudes are horrible. The human resource office is trustworthy.  EEO office does not return calls and everyday people are resigning.

pros: Morgan is going in a great direction and I absolutely love the new tag line 'Growing the Future, Leading the World'.
cons: Progress takes time but any advancement that can speed things up should be considered.

job_title: Administrative Assistant/Academic Counselor in Baltimore, MD
pros: An opportunity to advance your career by receiving the wonderful benefits of educational tuition wavier.  I matriculated four years free for my Bachelor of Arts degree and I am currently utilizing this benefit for my Masters degree.
cons: Processes are slow.  No career advancement opportunities.

job_title: Project Manager in Baltimore Corner, MD
pros: Previously work on contracts.  Out of all the jobs I've ever it was my working a a Project or Program Manager.  I've always been the on who leaves late until the work is completed.
cons: somewhat inconsistent employment if you stay with one Contractor

pros: Collaborative working environment, many new and/or recently renovated building, located in a major city, HBCU
cons: Limited resources for research support, Baltimore crime stats, higher percentage of underprepared students, limited ability to offer full-scholarships to graduate students

pros: The ability to help students, benefits, paid time off, and tuition remission.
cons: Lack of customer service, rate of pay,  leaving the principles of an HBCU.  The university has no pay structure.

review_title: Unaccountable staff and management at Morgan State University.

cons: Some disorganization with lack of harmonious policies enforcement. Every department seems to do its own thing.

pros: Educating students and preparing them for their careers. Flexibility of a teaching position has allowed me to develop some areas of scholarship and authorship.
cons: Low salary, poor employee support, unfair distribution of recognition. Environment and support structure like a community college, but expectations are those of a Harvard and MIT.

pros: Ok place to work and study. I worked part time as a GSA. Had it's issues occasionally but what university doesn't.
cons: Lack of communications between departments made administrative proccesses slow. Diffucult to get certain things accomplished. Professors were awesome and cared about students though.

review_title: My experience at Morgan State was a fantastic one, great company with great people.
